taskDescription: Refer to the image of Monopoly Junior in Figure 12.61. In Monopoly Junior each player can move from one space to another by rolling one six-sided die. Suppose that you constructed a graph to represent the Monopoly Junior board such that each vertex represented a space on the game board and each edge represented the ability of a player to move between two spaces based on a roll of the dice. Identify three differences between a graph based on Monopoly Junior and a graph based on the original Monopoly board discussed in Example 14 which would show the graphs are not isomorphic.
